scenes.background: (Bob) frowns and crosses his arms. (Monica) looks at you expectantly.
scenes.description: 'You always say we need a plan, but nothing changes. Are you going to help or not?'

options.text: I get your frustration. Let's discuss a better plan once I finish this urgent task.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's frustration and offered a future solution, demonstrating empathy and perception, though your motivation and self-regulation could be stronger.

options.text: I can't help right now. We should really rethink our approach to avoid this in the future.
options.analysis: You stood firm on your boundaries and suggested a future improvement, showcasing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation to help immediately.

options.text: It's always the same story. Maybe if you planned better, we wouldn't be in this mess.
options.analysis: Your response was somewhat passive-aggressive, showing lower empathy and self-regulation, which might strain your relationship with colleagues.
